plugins.name: Zero Me
plugins.description:
Zero Me: Center Your Starting Point


Start designing from anywhere on the canvas, and when you're ready, let Zero Me center your creations. Simply select your frames and objects, run the plugin, and Zero Me will position your designs at coordinates (0, 0), keeping your canvas clean and organized.


Zero Me is a small but mighty Figma plugin that simplifies the process of centering and aligning your designs. It's for designers who want to maintain a tidy workspace and ensure a consistent starting point for their projects.


Key Features:

1. Center Alignment: Zero Me sets the position of your selected frames and objects to coordinates (0, 0), providing a centered starting point for your designs.

2. Multiple Object Support: Select multiple frames and objects, and Zero Me will align them all to the center of the canvas.


Install Zero Me and experience the convenience of a centered starting point for your Figma designs.


Created by Taryn + Claude 3 Opus
plugins.tagline: Center you Frames, Objects, Sections, and Self üßò

‚ú® What you‚Äôll get:

plugins.name: UX Buddy - AI powered pair designer
plugins.description:
UX Buddy is your AI-powered design partner, built to streamline your UX workflow and enhance your design process within Figma.


  1. Uncover Assumptions: Identify and challenge underlying assumptions in your designs.
  2. Discover Edge Cases: Proactively find potential error states and unusual user interactions.
  3. Evaluate Usability: Get AI-driven feedback on the usability of your selected layers based on established heuristics.
  4. Check Accessibility: Perform quick accessibility checks, considering WCAG guidelines for aspects like color contrast and more.
  5. Contextual Analysis: Provide persona details, research insights, and other context to get more tailored feedback from your AI Buddy.
  6. Flexible AI Providers: Connect to various AI services including OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face, or your local Ollama instance.
  7. Customizable Prompts: Tailor UX Buddy to your specific needs by creating and managing your own prompt library.


Whether you're brainstorming, refining user flows, or conducting detailed evaluations, UX Buddy acts as an intelligent assistant, helping you make more informed design decisions and create better user experiences, faster.


--------

How to set up AI Provider:


‚òÅÔ∏è Option 1: Cloud APIs (OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face)


Use cloud-based AI models by connecting to one of these supported services.

  1. Select ‚ÄúCloud API‚Äù.
  2. Choose your service (OpenAI, GroqCloud, or Hugging Face) from the dropdown.
  3. Enter your credentials:
  4. OpenAI: API Key from platform.openai.com
  5. ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: OpenAI requires a funded account to use the API. Free trial credits may be available, but ongoing usage requires a billing setup.
  6. GroqCloud: API Key from console.groq.com
  7. Hugging Face: Access Token from huggingface.co/settings/tokens
  8. Enter the Model Name : choose a vision-capable model:
  9. OpenAI: e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4-vision-preview
  10. GroqCloud: e.g., meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct
  11. Hugging Face: e.g., google/gemma-3-27b-it
  12. Click ‚ÄúTest Current AI Connection‚Äù to verify everything works.


-----

üíª Option 2: Ollama (Local AI)


Use Ollama to run models locally on your machine‚Äîno internet required once models are downloaded.


üîß Prerequisites:

  1. Install Ollama: Download it from ollama.com.
  2. Run Ollama:
  3. Launch Ollama via terminal (ollama serve) or the desktop app.
  4. For convenience, you can set it up to run in the background automatically:
  5. macOS: via a plist launch agent
  6. Linux: via a systemd service (Note: These are part of your system configuration and not managed by UX Buddy.)
  7. Download Your Model:
  8. Use ollama pull llava or another vision-enabled model.
  9. Ensure the model supports your desired functionality (e.g., image analysis).


üõ†Ô∏è Configuration in UX Buddy:

  1. Select ‚ÄúOllama‚Äù as your provider.
  2. Enter your API Base URL ‚Äî usually http://localhost:11434.
  3. Enter the Model Name (e.g., llava, llama3, etc.).
  4. Click ‚ÄúTest Current AI Connection‚Äù.
plugins.tagline: Your AI-powered UX design partner.

plugins.name: Magic Renamer AI - With Design Token mode
plugins.description:
Magic Renamer AI is a Figma plugin that lets you automatically rename all your layers in one click (up to 120 layers at once, with design token support).


With AI, it suggests clear and consistent names that follow design and design system best practices.


üî•Key features:


  1. Smart, instant renaming: The AI analyzes your file and suggests relevant names for each layer.
  2. Time-saving: No more manual renaming‚Äîeverything is done in seconds, even for large files.
  3. Clarity and consistency: Naming conventions are enforced, making teamwork easier.
  4. Simple interface: One-click use, no complicated setup. Advanced options are available if you need them.
  5. Design token support: Perfect for solo or teams using advanced design systems.
  6. Custom API support: Use your own API key (OpenAI, DeepSeek, Perplexity, or OpenRouter) for more control.


üí° Why choose Magic Renamer AI?

Unlike other plugins, Magic Renamer AI uses artificial intelligence to understand the context of each layer and suggest names tailored to your project. It ensures consistency, reduces errors, and fits seamlessly into your Figma workflow. It‚Äôs the perfect tool to save time, improve file quality, and speed up your design process.
plugins.tagline: AI-powered batch renaming for Layers ‚Äî up to 120 at once -> Clarity | Consistency

plugins.name: Freaking Fake Data
plugins.description:
About plugin:

Freaking Fake Data simplifies your design workflow in Figma, FigJam and Slides by letting you fill mockups with custom, project-specific data instead of random content. Take control of your text layers, create tailored datasets and unify data formats for your design team ‚Äî perfect for consistent names, phone numbers or other details. Working locally, it boosts productivity and eliminates errors while speeding up mockup creation.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Mockup Filling: Quickly populate text layers with your data.
  2. Unified Team Data: Import a CSV or JSON file for team consistency.
  3. Bulk Text Magic: Mass-apply text to layers with one click.
  4. Cross-Platform Support: Works in Figma, FigJam and Slides.
  5. Easy Data Import: Upload CSV or JSON files instantly.
  6. Default Data Option: Test with preloaded samples (e.g., names, cities).


How to Use:

  1. Import Data: Create a table in a tool like Google Sheets or Excel, fill it with data, export as CSV or JSON, and upload‚Äîor use default data. Import multiple files and switch via tabs.
  2. Select Text Layers: Highlight the text layers to apply data to.
  3. Apply Data: Pick a column (e.g., "First Name") and apply data. Choose order:
  4. Sort: Inserts data in table order.
  5. Random: Inserts data in random order.
  6. Explore Options: Switch tabs, view rows, or use "Set as Default" to save a tab for next launch.


How to Create a Table:

  1. Enter data in columns (e.g., "First Name" in one, "City" in another); the first row becomes button names.
  2. Add separators by leaving a column empty with "---" or "- - -" in the header for a line or use "//Special Offers" or "// Special Offers" for a labeled group divider. (example: telegram)


Perfect for prototypes, presentations or team projects ‚Äî try it now!
plugins.tagline: Fill Mockups Quickly ‚Äî use unified data for your design team. Massively paste your text into Figma

plugins.name: PRE: AI Design Review
plugins.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs ‚Äî before a single line of code is written.


üîπ Select any frame in Figma and click ‚ÄúUpload Selected Frame‚Äù to send it to PRE.

üîπ PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

üîπ You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

üîπ Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics ‚Äî all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
plugins.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

plugins.name: Structura Swagger Annotator
plugins.description:
Description

Structura revolutionizes how you manage API, design, and copy documentation. With an all-in-one platform, gain clarity on workflows, discover the exact APIs and components used, and ensure precise copies across your designs.


How To?

  1. Run this plugin into your figma files
  2. Paste the whole swagger documentation
  3. Select one of the component and map it by filling the correct path and method
  4. To update the swagger just reupload again the whole json swagger


Feature Request?

Feel free to request more features, for this plugin. Next roadmap for this plugin will be:

  1. Code generation for API request
  2. Hands On API Request on Plugin
  3. Copywriter integration(such as integrating with lokalise)
plugins.tagline: Simplify API and Design documentation by annotating component with swagger API docs.

plugins.name: Hive
plugins.description:
Tired of endless swiping, cluttered frames, and struggling to stay focused?

Say hello to Hive, the ultimate Figma plugin designed to transform your design process. With its minimalist approach and powerful features, Hive ensures a smoother, more organized, and efficient workflow for designers and teams alike. Perfect for those working on complex projects with multiple screens and teams presenting designs or collaborating on organized workspaces.


Key Features

üóÇ Create Categories: Group frames into organized categories for a streamlined workflow.

üîç Zoom-In Functionality: Quickly focus on specific categories, making navigation seamless.

üéØ Smooth Screen Presentation: Eliminate the frustration of moving around messy frames while presenting. Hive ensures a clean, irritation-free presentation experience.

‚ö° Simplified Workflow: Minimalist, easy-to-use interface that saves time and effort.

üîÑ Quick Frame Switching: Easily switch between frames without excessive swiping, allowing for a faster and more efficient workflow as you move through different tasks.


Why This Plugin?

When working on large design files, scrolling endlessly, searching for frames, or jumping between screens during team presentations can be chaotic and jarring to the eye. Hive eliminates the frustration by organizing frames into clear categories and enabling zoom-in functionality. Whether you're working alone or presenting designs to your team, Hive keeps your workspace smooth, clean, and irritation-free.

üöÄ Boost Productivity: Spend less time navigating and more time designing.

üóÇÔ∏è Stay Organized: Keep your navigation intuitive without modifying your file structure.

üéØ Improve Focus: Streamline your workflow to maintain momentum on your creative projects.

ü§ù Enhance Collaboration: Share organized and easy-to-navigate files with your team, fostering better teamwork and understanding.

‚è≥ Save Time: Glide‚Äôs intuitive features reduce the time spent on repetitive tasks, giving you more room for creativity.


Ready to Hive? Try it out now and watch your productivity soar. Let your designs flow effortlessly. Organize, focus, and present without distractions.
plugins.tagline: Hive: Organise. Categorise. Focus.

plugins.name: Swift Layer Exporter
plugins.description:
Manage the layers you want to export based on their name. Just add the file type extension (.jpg, .png, .svg, .pdf) to any layer. With the plugin open select any layer or any parent and all of the tagged layers will automatically be found to export.


You can also set the export scale by adding a percent 200% after the extension. You can also set the layer cropping to its native bounding box with the tag = or to the base frame with #.


  1. button.png # 200% - exports the layer button as a png at 200% in the size of the layout base frame.
  2. button.svg = 100% - exports the layer button as a svg at 100% in the size of the layer.
plugins.tagline: Manage export layers by name

plugins.name: Consistency Checker
plugins.description:
Consistency Checker is your all-in-one solution for ensuring your designs meet WCAG AA standards for text contrast. With a single click, check the accessibility of all text layers in a selected frame, helping you create more inclusive designs effortlessly.


Designing for accessibility shouldn't be an afterthought. Consistency Checker analyzes all text layers within a selected frame, instantly providing contrast ratio information and WCAG AA compliance status.


What This Plugin Does

  1. Evaluates text contrast ratios against backgrounds for all text layers simultaneously
  2. Shows WCAG AA pass/fail status for each text element
  3. Provides detailed contrast ratio measurements
  4. Allows quick navigation to problematic text layers with a single click
  5. Helps you identify accessibility issues early in your design process
  6. Generates comprehensive reports for documentation and team sharing


How It Works

  1. Select any frame containing text layers you want to evaluate
  2. Run Consistency Checker to instantly scan all text elements
  3. View a complete list of text layers with their contrast ratios and WCAG AA compliance status
  4. Click on any text layer in the results to jump directly to it in your design
  5. Make necessary adjustments to improve accessibility
  6. Re-scan to confirm your changes meet accessibility standards


Simplify your accessibility workflow and ensure your designs are inclusive for all users. Install Consistency Checker today!
plugins.tagline: Simplify your accessibility workflow and ensure your designs are inclusive for all users

plugins.name: Text Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUS


Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

‚Ä¢Font size

‚Ä¢Font weight

‚Ä¢Font family


Additionally, the plugin documents‚Äîbut does not apply‚Äîthe following properties:

‚Ä¢Line height

‚Ä¢Letter spacing


This is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.


For example:

If the original line-height is 100%, the plugin will store it as a variable with:

variableName: 100%, variableValue: 1em (calculated as 100 √∑ 100 √ó 1em)


Naming Convention for text styles:


To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:

‚Ä¢Use the prefix title- followed by a number (e.g., title-1) for headings

‚Ä¢Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

‚Ä¢text-2-buttonLabel


This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.
plugins.tagline: By Fede Luna

plugins.name: Token Template
plugins.description: When working with variables on an ongoing project, the structure of your variables evolves with each version. This plugin allows you to create "Releases" to capture the current state of your document's variables and export them in individual structures, distinguishing between active and older versions. Token Template also helps you maintain identical variable exports across multiple Figma documents. The plugin is currently in beta.

plugins.name: Fixiq ‚Äî Fix the scale of working area
plugins.description:
Intro

In Figma, the current scale is not shown anywhere on the canvas. You can‚Äôt see how far you have moved from the actual scale of the frame. You can only select the frame and see its dimensions. And then estimate the ratio of pixels to percentages.


In Figma, you can zoom in to 100% once using hotkeys. But any movement on the board can lead to an accidental change in scale.


Solution

Fixiq not only fixes the 100% scale, but can also change it to 50%, 100%, 200%.


Plugin will be useful not only for designers, but also for managers. With Fixiq you can easily design interfaces of non-standard sizes/proportions and be sure about the scale you're working with. Your layouts will always be in the actual/original size. Managers can present project results to clients without irritating zooming.

accepted.name: Roman Nebel
accepted.description: IT Manager / UX Expert / Pet-projects Developer

plugins.tagline: Figma plugin that fixes the scale of working area

plugins.name: Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder
plugins.description:
Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder For Dev Mode


Varcator is a Figma plugin that helps you find where text variables are being used in your design files. It provides an efficient way to scan and track variable usage across your Figma projects.


üî• Highly Recommend to select one variable at a time. üî•


Features


  1. Variable Collection Scanning: Scan all text variables in your Figma file
  2. Selective Scanning: Choose which variables to scan for usage
  3. Usage Tracking: Find where each variable is being used
  4. Interactive UI: Click on usages to navigate to the specific layers
  5. Efficient Processing: Optimized scanning with rate limiting to prevent API throttling
  6. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive design for easy variable management

plugins.name: Fillio - Elevate design with dynamic content
plugins.description:
Fillio - Less Typing, More Designing


Fillio is the simplest way to populate your Figma designs with realistic {{placeholder}} content. Whether you‚Äôre working on wireframes, prototypes, invoices, brand books, or daily UI design, Fillio saves you time by instantly filling your artboards with dynamic content.



Key Features:


Quick & Easy Filling:

Fill your designs with placeholders like names, addresses, and all type of contents in a single click.


Customizable Placeholders:

Use simple tags like {{name}} or {{Date}} to create dynamic content that fits your design.


Efficient Workflow:

Skip the tedious task of manually adding content‚Äîlet Fillio do the heavy lifting.


Perfect for Prototypes & Wireframes:

Make your designs look polished even in early stages, without all the manual effort.



How it Works:


  1. Install Fillio from the Figma Community.
  2. Select the elements or frames where you want to add placeholders.
  3. Define Your Placeholders using simple tags like {{name}} or {{Type}}.
  4. Click ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äù, and Fillio automatically adds content to your design.



Get Started with Fillio Today!
